title: Social animal - David Brooks

multiple-choice.question: According to the speaker, what is the main limitation of the current view of human nature?

options.text: It is too focused on reason and ignores emotions.

options.label: B
options.text: It is too narrow and does not account for individual differences.

options.label: C
options.text: It is too simplistic and does not consider the complexity of human behavior.

options.label: D
options.text: It is too focused on material wealth and ignores spiritual values and relationships.

options.label: D
options.text: To regulate the body's physiological functions

options.label: B
options.text: The French view emphasizes individualism, while the British view emphasizes social relationships.

options.label: C
options.text: The French view emphasizes material wealth, while the British view emphasizes values and relationships.

options.label: D
options.text: The French view emphasizes science, while the British view emphasizes philosophy.

options.label: B
options.text: To seek moments of transcendence and connection with others

options.label: B
options.text: It will lead to more compassionate and effective policies.

options.label: C
options.text: It will lead to more simplistic and one-size-fits-all policies.

options.label: D
options.text: It will lead to more complex and nuanced policies.
